titlestmt.titleproper: A. James Delahoussaye collection of Atchafalaya River Basin recordings
titlestmt.subtitle: AFC 2012/044
titlestmt.author: Prepared by Kate Stewart

publicationstmt.publisher: American Folklife Center, Library of Congress

seriesstmt.titleproper: Guides to the Collections in the Archive of Folk Culture

Finding aid encoded by Kate Stewart

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle:
A. James Delahoussaye collection of Atchafalaya River Basin recordings
1974-2010
did.physdesc: 635 photographs : digital, JPEG files, color, black and white.

corpname.part: Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress

did.abstract: Collection of field recordings of interviews with Atchafalaya River Basin, Louisiana, residents about their lives, traditions, and folkways, recorded from 1974-2010, as well as approximately 645 digital images documenting the same traditions. Interviews were conducted by Alphe James (Jim) Delahoussaye. Digital images were created by his colleague, Darlene Soulé, of many of the same informants. Topics include fresh water fishing and shrimping, other animals and animal husbandry, cooking, medicine, weather, logging, community gatherings, religion and churches, boat building, courtship, marriage, and education. These residents of the Atchafalaya River Basin, many of whom were elderly at the time of the interviews, recall traditions and events experienced from the 1880s and through the 20th century. Photographs are digital copies of original family photographs dating from the 1920s to the present.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

subject.part: Funeral rites and ceremonies--Louisiana--Atchafalaya River Region.

geogname.part: Atchafalaya River Watershed (La.)--Social life and customs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into the following series: I. Manuscripts; II. Interviews and Events (arranged chronologically); and III. Photographs (arranged by file name).

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: The bulk of the collection was received in 2012. Additional transcripts were acquired in 2014 and more may be acquired at a later date.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The collection was processed by Bert Lyons in 2012.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Duplication of collection materials may be governed by copyright and other restrictions.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Access may be restricted during processing. To request materials, please contact the Folklife Reading Room at http://hdl.loc.gov/loc.afc/folklife.contact

altformavail.head: Digital copies
altformavail.p: Additional formats received with the collection (for tapes 1-83): 156 sound files, WAV : digital.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: A. James Delahoussaye collection of Atchafalaya River Basin recordings (AFC 2012/044), Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: A. James (Jim) Delahoussaye was born in New Iberia, Louisiana, in 1938. He is an environmental scientist, teacher, and commercial fisherman, who is working on the ethnology of the Atchafalaya houseboat communities and the analysis of animal bone from prehistoric Indian middens.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection of field recordings of interviews with Atchafalaya River Basin, Louisiana, residents about their lives, traditions, and folkways, recorded from 1974-2010, as well as approximately 635 digital images documenting the same traditions. Interviews were conducted by Alphe James (Jim) Delahoussaye at the residences of the interviewees; at reunions, funerals, and other events; and also on boats and in cars. Digital images of family photographs, dating from the 1920s to the present, were created by his colleague, Darlene Soulé, of many of the same informants. Topics include fresh water fishing and shrimping, other animals and animal husbandry, cooking, medicine, weather, logging, community gatherings, religion and churches, boat building, courtship, marriage, and education. They also reflect on the building of levees in the area and environmental change and the histories of the Couvillier, Bailey, Sauce, Daigle, and Millet families. These residents of the Atchafalaya River Basin, many of whom were elderly at the time of the interviews, recall traditions and events experienced from the 1880s and through the 20th century.

did.unittitle: Finding aid and summaries of interviews by A. James Delahoussaye

scopecontent.p: Ninety-six recordings and 49 transcripts of 79 oral history interviews and events conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in the Atchafalaya River Basin, Louisiana, arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle:
Albert (Myon) Bailey, Agnes Bailey, Putt Couvillier, Edward Couvillier, and Lena Mae Couvillier oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in St. Mary Parish, Louisiana.,
1974

scopecontent.p: Recorded at the residence of Albert (Myon) Bailey on Oxford Loop. Interviewees discuss Millet (Myette) Point, and the levee community.

did.unittitle:
Albert (Myon) Bailey, Agnes Bailey, Putt Couvillier, Edward Couvillier, and Lena Mae Couvillier oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Millet (Myette) Point, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
1974

scopecontent.p: Recorded at the levee at Millet (Myette) Point. Interviewees discuss Millet (Myette) Point, the levee community, and an air-cooled washing machine.

did.unittitle:
Albert (Myon) Bailey, Agnes Bailey, Putt Couvillier, and Dorothy Couvillier oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Millet (Myette) Point, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
1974

scopecontent.p: Recorded at the residence of Albert (Myon) Bailey on Oxford Loop and the residence of Albert (Putt) Couvillier. Interviewees discuss Millet (Myette) Point, the levee community, Blaise’s death story.

did.unittitle:
Interview with Albert (Myon) Bailey, Agnes Bailey, Edward Couvillier, Lena Mae Couvillier, Kevin Couvillier, Carolyn Delahoussaye, and Dorothy Couvillier conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Oxford, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
January 26, 1989

scopecontent.p: Recorded at the residence of Albert (Myon) and Agnes Bailey on Oxford Loop. Interviewees discuss illnesses, family, boats, fishing, and football.

did.unittitle:
Albert (Myon) Bailey and Agnes Bailey oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Oxford, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
1989

scopecontent.p: Recorded at the residence of Albert (Myon) Bailey on Oxford Loop. Interviewees discuss a miscarriage and how they met.

did.unittitle:
Interview with Albert (Myon) Bailey and Agnes Bailey conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Oxford, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
1989

scopecontent.p: Recorded at the residence of Albert (Myon) Bailey on Oxford Loop. Interviewees discuss family history, food, funerals, cemeteries, and dating.

did.unittitle:
Comments by A. James Delahoussaye in Louisiana,
November 20, 1992

scopecontent.p: Recorded while riding in a vehicle. Delahoussaye's memories of the small commercial fishing industry in the Atchafalaya Basin and Albert (Myon) Bailey.

did.unittitle:
Interview with Edward Couvillier and Lena Mae Couvillier conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Oxford, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
December 10, 1995

scopecontent.p: Recorded at the residence of Edward Couvillier on Oxford Loop. Interviewees discuss the floods, houseboats, fishing and trapping, family, levee crossing in 1945, the Gondolfos, residents of Myon’s canal, location of the houseboat community, walking to school, and walking/rowing to visit the Burns.

did.unittitle:
Agnes Bailey, Edward Couvillier, Lena Mae Couvillier, and Dorothy Couvillier oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Oxford, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
December 17, 1995

scopecontent.p: Recorded at the residence of Edward Couvillier on Oxford Loop. Interviewees discuss home life, who crossed the levee, accidents, medicine, religion, school at Millet (Myette) Point, and genealogy.

did.unittitle:
Joseph Sauce, Jr. and Florence Sauce oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Franklin, Louisiana,
December 26, 1995

scopecontent.p: Recorded at the residence of Joe Sauce, Jr., and his wife Florence Anslem Sauce. Interviewees discuss the Anslem family, houseboats, fishing technology, Lockwood Ash to air-cooleds to outboards, bugging, and seminary.

did.unittitle:
Joseph Sauce, Jr., Florence Sauce, EJ Daigle, and Blue Daigle oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Franklin, Louisiana,
December 26, 1995

scopecontent.p: Recorded at residence of Joe Sauce, Jr., and his wife Florence Anslem Sauce. Interviewees discuss tools, putting out a line with hooks, outboards, and boats.

did.unittitle:
EJ Daigle and Blue Daigle oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Franklin, Louisiana,
December 26, 1995

scopecontent.p: Recorded at the residence of EJ Daigle and his wife Blue. Interviewees discuss cribs, EJ's father's stroke, moves over the levee, tools, coastal shrimp, white eels, wire main line, Daigle property at 4 Mile, and baits.

did.unittitle:
Edward Couvillier, Lena Mae Couvillier, Agnes Bailey, Joe Sauce, EJ Daigle, and Carolyn Delahoussaye oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Louisiana,
December 28, 1995

scopecontent.p: Recorded in a moving vehicle on a trip from Millet (Myette) Point to Napoleonville, Attakapas Landing, and Pierre Part, Louisiana. Interviewees discuss Bayou Chene, family, fishing, shrimping, taxes, dancing at the Rainbow Inn, and Pierre Part.

did.unittitle:
Cleo “Neg” Sauce, Edward Couvillier, and Lena Mae Couvillier oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Oxford, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
January 2, 1996

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Cleo “Neg” Sauce’s house at Oxford Loop. Interviewees discuss the Depression, daily life, nets and lines, fishing alone, medicine, injuries, music and playing, and philosophy of worldly goods.

did.unittitle:
Cleo “Neg” Sauce oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Oxford, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
January 2, 1996

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Cleo “Neg” Sauce’s house on Oxford Loop. Interviewee discusses moving over the levee and houseboat locations.

did.unittitle:
Ida Daigle oral history interview conducted by James Delahoussaye in Oxford, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
January 4, 1996

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Ida Daigle’s house on Oxford Loop. Interviewee discusses the drowning of trees at Blaise’s Canal, the crab factory on Little Pigeon, courtship and her marriage to Jesse.

did.unittitle:
Russell Daigle oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Franklin, Louisiana,
January 7, 1996

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Russell Daigle’s house on Lee Charles St. Interviewee discusses family, the Anslem barge, his swamp philosophy, the use of nylon, sandbars on Goat Island, tools, weddings, and his campboat philosophy.

did.unittitle:
Russell Daigle, Gale Daigle, and Matthew Daigle oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Franklin, Louisiana,
January 7, 1996

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Russell Daigle’s house on Lee Charles St. Interviewees discuss tools, baits, white eels, moving to Oxford, school, medicine, and Russell Daigle's philosophy on illness.

did.unittitle:
Medric Martin, Edward Couvillier, and Agnes Bailey oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Oxford, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
January 1996

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Martin's general store on Irish Bend Road (LA 322) near location of old Oaklawn Sugar Mill and at Edward Couvillier’s house on Oxford Loop. Interviewees discuss Martin’s store, local people, mail, groceries, paid bills, Martin's relations with blacks, and the Millet (Myette) Point community.

did.unittitle:
Ida Daigle, Roy "Bootsie" Millet, Gloria Ann Marcotte, Edward Couvillier, Lena Mae Couvillier, Alvin Marcotte, and Ophelia "Yank" Millet oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Oxford, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
November 2, 1996 and January 2, 1997

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Edward Couvillier’s house on Oxford Loop. Interviewees discuss the origin of the Millet family, plantation stores, smoking gar meat, Edward and Lena Mae Couvillier's courtship and marriage, tools, fishing techniques crosslines and bentlines, and carbide lamps.

did.unittitle:
Edward Couvillier and Lena Mae Couvillier oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Oxford, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
January 2, 1997

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Edward Couvillier’s house on Oxford Loop. Interviewees discuss fishboat trips, the murder of Couvillier's uncle, chain dog use (logs), old tools, motors, move to get kids to school, Father Gobeil, baits, snakes, shrimp catching, white eels, “ansoirs,” first cars, burns, first whiskey roaches, fishboat, the peddler, and fishboat supplies.

did.unittitle:
Neg Sauce oral history interview conducted by James Delahoussaye in Oxford, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
January 1997

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Neg Sauce’s house on Oxford Loop. Interviewee discusses tools, leaving the swamp, first use of nylon, and sandbars.

did.unittitle:
Neg Sauce oral history interview conducted by James Delahoussaye in Oxford, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
January 1997

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Neg Sauce’s house on Oxford Loop. Interviewee discusses the death of Blaise Sauce, “ansoirs,” white eels, and his philosophy of the good life.

did.unittitle:
Jerry Marcotte and Edward Couvillier oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Oxford, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
August 23, 2003

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Edward Couvillier’s house on Oxford Loop. Interviewees discuss levee building, barpits, houseboats, and seine fishing.

did.unittitle:
Edward Couvillier, Lena Mae Couvillier, Margaret Couvillier Neal, and Evest Neal oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Lafayette, Louisiana,
January 9, 2005

scopecontent.p: Recorded in a hospital room. Interviewees discuss Hog Island school, livestock on cribs, making clothes, making quilts, making and maintaining moss mattresses, cornshucks mattresses, in-laws, midwives, snow at Millet (Myette) Point, the birth of Lena Mae's baby, washing floors and clothes, the garfish that took Lena Mae's ring, and being punished with kneeling.

did.unittitle:
Bayou Chene Reunion in Morgan City, Louisiana,
September 18, 2004

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Lake End Park.

did.unittitle:
Dorothy Couvillier, Lena Mae Couvillier, Edward Couvillier, Danna Halpin, and Stanley Halpin conducted by A. James Delahoussaye and Danna Halpin in Franklin, Louisiana,
February 2, 2005

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Dorothy Couvillier’s house on Highway 87. Interviewees discuss breakfast foods, ways of cooking, preserving food in lard, views of early life, and medicines.

did.unittitle:
Chris Daigle oral history interview conducted by James Delahoussaye in Louisiana,
April 10, 2005

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Chris Daigle's residence on Cayce St., Franklin, Louisiana.

did.unittitle:
Edward Couvillier and Lena Mae Couvillier oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye,
August 13, 2005

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Edward Couvillier’s house on Oxford Loop. Interviewees discuss the river shrimp study, how river shrimp were harvested traditionally, other species of shrimp, maps, location of Blaise’s Canal, storms and rough water, and the openness of Grand Lake before sandbars.

did.unittitle:
EJ Daigle and Blue Daigle oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye and Raymond T. Bauer in Franklin, Louisiana,
August 13, 2005

scopecontent.p: Recorded at the residence of EJ Daigle and his wife Blue on Milling Street. Interviewees discuss river shrimp, seasons, techniques of capture, other shrimp species, migration, sharks, jumping carp, and tarpon.

did.unittitle:
Edward Couvillier, Lena Mae Couvillier, Ray Brassieur, and Jason Foster oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
September 17, 2004

scopecontent.p: Recorded in a vehicle on the way to the Bayou Chene Reunion. Interviewees discuss The Pit in Morgan City and The Cutgrass Inn.

did.unittitle:
Edward Couvillier oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Raceland, Louisiana,
March 8, 2006

scopecontent.p: Recorded in a vehicle on the way to get boat plywood. Interviewees discuss tarring nets, cypress vs. tupelo, Lockwood cigarette lighter, moss gathering/industry, crawfish in old days, foggy times, duck hunting stories, a boat accident with Medric, ghost stories, logging, booming sinker logs, timber thieves, and Ben Law.

did.unittitle:
Carl Carline oral history interview conducted by James Delahoussaye in Louisiana,
April 5, 2006

scopecontent.p: Recorded on board the COE Towboat MV Mississippi for the Mississippi River High Water Survey trip. Interviewee discusses his parents, mother was a midwife and healer, sawing firewood for family income, castrating pigs and cows, learning to fish, inventing a jiggerpole, father's work as a fishboat operator, education, food habits, houseboat life, the Burns murder, Joyce and Carl's courtship and married life, Joyce’s 16th birthday party, flying home on furlough, living in Texas and fishing in Louisiana, and building a pirogue.

did.unittitle:
Edward Couvillier oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
April 15, 2006

scopecontent.p: Recorded in a vehicle traveling from Morgan City to Franklin. Interviewees discuss cutting timber for the May Brothers, movies in Franklin, music at Charenton Beach, Son Burgess fighting at Charenton, and working in the mill and fishing.

did.unittitle:
Edward Couvillier, Lena Mae Couvillier, Greg Guirard, Ray Brassieur, Larry Couvillier, and Justin Couvillier oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Oxford, Louisiana,
May 3, 2006

scopecontent.p: Recorded at the residence of Edward Couvillier on Oxford Loop. Interviewees discuss Bill Sanders/Jules Chauvin shooting, shrimp and the Red River rise, Anslems and cypress, and the Little Brown Church.

did.unittitle:
Carl Carline, Joyce Carline, Edward Couvillier, Lena Mae Couvillier, and Bob Vuillemont oral history interview conducted by James Delahoussaye at the Bayou Chene Reunion in Morgan City, Louisiana,
September 16, 2006

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Lake End Park. Interviewees discuss Mose Larson strong, a 14 foot gator, Buffalo spawn story, and “Sap” Couvillier flotation story.

did.unittitle:
Robert Vuillemont and Edward Couvillier oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye at the Bayou Chene Reunion in Morgan City, Louisiana,
September 9, 2006

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Lake End Park, Morgan City. Interviewees discuss boats and fishing.

did.unittitle:
Bonita Couvillier Newsome, Larry Couvillier, Justin Couvillier, and Edward Couvillier oral history interview conducted by James Delahoussaye in Louisiana,
November 1, 2006

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Lena Mae Couvillier’s funeral. Interviewees tell family stories.

did.unittitle:
Darlene Soulé, Edward Couvillier, and Liza Henry oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye near Olivier, Iberia Parish, Louisiana.,
January 26, 2007

scopecontent.p: Recorded at the residence of Eliza (Liza) Louise Domingue Couvillier Henry on Crochet Road. Interviewees discuss a fire on a houseboat, McKinley's murder, orphanage, school, Lake Dauterive, medicine, courtship and marriage to Abner Couvillier, ghost stories, whisky roaches, churches, and family.

did.unittitle:
Carl Carline, Kathy Carline, Earl Kelley oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Charenton, Louisiana,
March 26, 2007

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Tunney Carline's funeral. Interviewees discuss funerals, casket building, and stories about Tunney Carline.

did.unittitle:
Edward Couvillier, Pamela Cameron, and James Reiter oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Oxford, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
April 22, 2007 and July 11, 2007

scopecontent.p: Recorded at the residence of Edward Couvillier on Oxford Loop. Interviewees discuss family, catching frogs, the Depression, fishing, Nick Burns, the future of the fishing industry, dating, grandparents, moving across the levee, sandbars, and houseboats.

did.unittitle:
Carl Carline, Joyce Carline and Mike Soprano oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Charenton, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana,
June 20, 2007

scopecontent.p: Recorded on a boat at Lake Fausse Point, St. Mary/Iberia Parish and at the residence of Carl and Joyce Carline on Sanaren Drive. Interviewees discuss making a living in the fishing industry, ghost stories, fishing bait, pirate John Lafitte, burial mounds, and boats stuck in sandbars.

did.unittitle:
Edward Couvillier, Justin Couvillier, and Larry Couvillier oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Oxford, St. Mary Parish, Louisiana and at the,
July 26, 2007 and

scopecontent.p: Recorded at the residence of Edward Couvillier on Oxford Loop. Interviewees discuss the Anslem family, Couvillier family, canals, Little Pigeon Bayou, and Big Pigeon Bayou.

Carl Carline oral history interview conducted by James Delahoussaye in Louisiana,
August 2007

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Russell Daigle’s funeral.

Bayou Chene Reunion in Morgan City, Louisiana and Edward Couvillier oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Louisiana,

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Lake End Park and in a vehicle. Interviewees discuss women and work.

scopecontent.p: Recorded at the residences of Edward Couvillier and Carl Carline.

Edward Couvillier oral history interview conducted by A. James Delahoussaye in Louisiana,
November 29, 2011

scopecontent.p: Recorded at Emily Kelley Carline’s funeral. Interviewees discuss early fishing days, outdoor toilets, pulling contests with putt putt boats, floating moss, and storage using barges with a closed cabin.

Six hundred and thirty-five digital photographs (copies of original family print photographs) collected by Darlene Soulé from 11 families in the Atchafalaya River Basin, Louisiana, arranged by ID number.
